page.title: 11BRIGHTON MARINA : PLANNING
page.content: The idea for the marina was proposed by Henry Cohen and plans were drawn up in l963. A site at Black Rock was chosen and work began in l97l. The main objectives were to provide a {yacht harbour}offering the best facilities in the world, to provide residential accomodation of l,OOO {flats}&{houses,}car parking for 6,OOO cars,{shops,}an{hotel}& a{conference {centre.}It is now the largest purpose-built marina in Britain and it has cost Â£5Om to complete just Phase One. By 1979 economic conditions had changed and the secondary development has not taken place. However the marina has been sold to another developer, Brent Walker Ltd. who intend to press ahead with housing, shops & the hotel etc. subject to the necessary planning approvals.
